wms_article.title: Businesses should industrialize IPs to create global demand: KCCI

wms_article_body.body: South Korean companies lag far behind others in turning cultural content into merchandise sales, a report showed on Sunday. According to a report released by the Korea Chamber of Commerce and Industry, there was no Korean company that ranked among the world’s top 50 licensors by retail sales of goods produced from cultural content properties. U.S. companies, on the other hand, dominated the rankings, with The Walt Disney Company leading at about $62 billion in merchandise sales in 2024 through collaborations with clothing brands and retailers. Hasbro Inc. generated $16.1 billion from franchises such as Transformers, while Warner Bros. Entertainment Inc. earned $15 billion from characters including Batman, the report said. The KCCI called for a “cultural industrialization” strategy to strengthen Korea’s capability to commercialize intellectual property and sustain global demand.
